document.title: TEXAS ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS FOR SPANISH LANGUAGE ARTS AND READING AND ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE

E94A23BD0F76499AB135E2F4BD8353E6.description: use an appropriate mode of delivery, whether written, oral, or multimodal, to present results.

4581307FC981489DA5B434A5E252A76C.description: display academic citations and use source materials ethically; and

D66EFF98B8654BBA94027FFAC9250D52.description: faulty reasoning such as hyperbole, emotional appeals, and stereotype;

B13C42B207A94FB28B8C13942DD8D71A.description: differentiate between paraphrasing and plagiarism when using source materials;

0C0C757982CE4AEEA4CB20283E3AE7F1.description: synthesize information from a variety of sources;

15D77A1708B0489D86361E94BC923F8B.description: differentiate between primary and secondary sources;

0B1EFDA1684A4B718E2FFDB9F6A46652.description: identify and gather relevant information from a variety of sources;

F02814B1C9B0490D9C2241D6A9C27A3D.description: refine the major research question, if necessary, guided by the answers to a secondary set of questions;

0B668D8487184D3A8E28505212D4EFD6.description: generate student-selected and teacher-guided questions for formal and informal inquiry;

EEF3DA1E115A4EDBB9F028169CA7955D.description: Inquiry and research: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student engages in both short-term and sustained recursive inquiry processes for a variety of purposes. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

CF084B0DB9784CAE8E02015D3C4EF92C.description: compose correspondence that reflects an opinion, registers a complaint, or requests information in a business or friendly structure.

1D5E68D59AC645DDB6BBA4350A072AB3.description: compose multi-paragraph argumentative texts using genre characteristics and craft; and

DA85B888FAA744C5A47FCBDED8B9D4B1.description: compose informational texts, including multi-paragraph essays that convey information about a topic, using a clear controlling idea or thesis statement and genre characteristics and craft;

24B539C35E274B8BA062C5913C48F8BD.description: compose literary texts such as personal narratives, fiction, and poetry using genre characteristics and craft;

FECDA5EAC68B498C82B811CFFC0BE12E.description: Composition: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--genres. The student uses genre characteristics and craft to compose multiple texts that are meaningful. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

29B8EF1F47BF49BA94B14315810242CA.description: publish written work for appropriate audiences.

F3EF79AB7BBB4222BD99EC7B683D0234.description: correct spelling, including commonly confused terms such as its/it's, affect/effect, there/their/they're, and to/two/too; and

DC744F3AD80546BCA3B5A992E44E74CE.description: punctuation, including commas to set off words, phrases, and clauses and semicolons; and

5F93525AEDB945D08DC8F47B4823732E.description: subordinating conjunctions to form complex sentences and correlative conjunctions such as either/or and neither/nor;

0A1BDF2394FD423189F3F3D5CC9E633A.description: prepositions and prepositional phrases and their influence on subject-verb agreement;

1279F0B847454B2BA845FEAF269A6607.description: consistent, appropriate use of verb tenses;

480BA392AE9645CCB0CE482CB3DF458A.description: complete simple, compound, and complex sentences with subject-verb agreement and avoidance of splices, run-ons, and fragments;

8B14632C1EF44453A7FDBEBBF8D629C8.description: edit drafts using standard English conventions, including:

C1D20B7C37834754ADAE0A9C99637513.description: revise drafts for clarity, development, organization, style, word choice, and sentence variety;

BF6FA8B43416459B9BA0CA4F19101CBE.description: developing an engaging idea reflecting depth of thought with specific facts, details, and examples;

02299FD5190A4BC5B7CB99FCF7AF5C25.description: organizing with purposeful structure, including an introduction, transitions, coherence within and across paragraphs, and a conclusion; and

94A3B316305940D4A6118055388EB816.description: develop drafts into a focused, structured, and coherent piece of writing by:

8E62560CD3B44558870AC710E93B4790.description: plan a first draft by selecting a genre appropriate for a particular topic, purpose, and audience using a range of strategies such as discussion, background reading, and personal interests;

4603F1FB18604BB8979DC2E9FC8C688C.description: Composition: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--writing process. The student uses the writing process recursively to compose multiple texts that are legible and uses appropriate conventions. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

D85611015A2E47169E5DB0AA9FC07E06.description: explain the purpose of rhetorical devices such as direct address and rhetorical questions and logical fallacies such as loaded language and sweeping generalizations.

4D58D384FEA6436EB81BEBE9AC9A46FF.description: analyze how the author's use of language contributes to mood, voice, and tone; and

D95613BE1C294117A102DB920A2BAC5E.description: identify the use of literary devices, including subjective and objective point of view;

56E260B01D8D47E19856E8ECF9DA5651.description: describe how the author's use of figurative language such as metaphor and personification achieves specific purposes;

81CBFD0BBC5040B3B1F0125B33085CB6.description: analyze the author's use of print and graphic features to achieve specific purposes;

4143544E44D04A20917D0271BACB5473.description: analyze how the use of text structure contributes to the author's purpose;

4FCE716A335040DF84442AA6C318F26A.description: explain the author's purpose and message within a text;

AA6E5F7FA4684B0CA7B37B850DA1C2AB.description: Author's purpose and craft: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student uses critical inquiry to analyze the authors' choices and how they influence and communicate meaning within a variety of texts. The student analyzes and applies author's craft purposefully in order to develop his or her own products and performances. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

BCA99450100D468D9150D371316BAF39.description: analyze characteristics of multimodal and digital texts.

CCCEC4251F0140E892F3C33A506036D4.description: identifying the intended audience or reader; and

32C95FC8B40846AE81CB254B47CCE65E.description: explaining how the author uses various types of evidence and consideration of alternatives to support the argument; and

D63FB3B525A440DFBCF6D0AB93BC2E74.description: analyze characteristics and structures of argumentative text by:

3C54F2C9D02A4092A7B8C3A274035B09.description: organizational patterns that support multiple topics, categories, and subcategories;

97DC1597214A4F94941C984ED44A46A1.description: features such as references or acknowledgements, chapters, sections, subsections, bibliography, tables, graphs, captions, bullets, and numbers; and

AD0FD4CBF4EC48449B4A994F632F40F9.description: the controlling idea or thesis with supporting evidence;

10DB62168BAA42F08EFAFE861065E187.description: analyze characteristics and structural elements of informational text, including:

506F0D04624B43739567AE1676BD1BEF.description: analyze how playwrights develop characters through dialogue and staging;

844C5F6157D44F0F89EA009995F69FA7.description: analyze the effect of rhyme scheme, meter, and graphical elements such as punctuation and capitalization in poems across a variety of poetic forms;

1EB13951852E4660B21961169362CFF5.description: demonstrate knowledge of literary genres such as realistic fiction, adventure stories, historical fiction, mysteries, humor, myths, fantasy, and science fiction;

F6884D66829840E59F2E3E1B16B15637.description: Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--genres. The student recognizes and analyzes genre-specific characteristics, structures, and purposes within and across increasingly complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

6944CA02DEDD4377B5645187FD586293.description: analyze how the setting influences character and plot development.

10028DF9AEEC47FA82333083673CEA9B.description: analyze plot elements, including the use of foreshadowing and suspense, to advance the plot; and

66F332BEB3AF4F8F996B89FC306EFDB1.description: analyze how characters' qualities influence events and resolution of the conflict;

43CB0A96D4984CA8AF5647F2CD4632B2.description: infer multiple themes within and across texts using text evidence;

3D5AD68E71FA4F78B6B681C0A31ADF83.description: Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--literary elements. The student recognizes and analyzes literary elements within and across increasingly complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse literary texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

10CE9D5F90634B9A84A3977ABFBAA98E.description: reflect on and adjust responses as new evidence is presented.

6EA0F0519905469A81DDAE4B47D603D5.description: respond orally or in writing with appropriate register, vocabulary, tone, and voice; and

D5429315E3E04D8D90F18F1F11663673.description: discuss and write about the explicit or implicit meanings of text;

FC46B3E8D25F4547B5B2641A501FCD57.description: respond using newly acquired vocabulary as appropriate;

DB07EA52A16D49A4A396A59B2C431054.description: interact with sources in meaningful ways such as notetaking, annotating, freewriting, or illustrating;

F8BD69F25F5942B5B32FF346E5F20D9E.description: paraphrase and summarize texts in ways that maintain meaning and logical order;

33EA0E3C81E94CA4B293C97C5E3B5395.description: use text evidence to support an appropriate response;

A82DB07431CD4C3CB6EACBF88468CC87.description: write responses that demonstrate understanding of texts, including comparing sources within and across genres;

05B7E8118E6F47FBAAA9A7BA3801B04D.description: describe personal connections to a variety of sources, including self-selected texts;

F5D14462FF574B98B95D0D9489EA5BEC.description: Response skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student responds to an increasingly challenging variety of sources that are read, heard, or viewed. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

94906CD4347D4E94B025038C2422E4F8.description: monitor comprehension and make adjustments such as re-reading, using background knowledge, asking questions, and annotating when understanding breaks down.

7DF9AA55A40D4D25B87254F69E6F03D5.description: synthesize information to create new understanding; and

576D27E2F2694A679CA29BB2C04E0E6D.description: evaluate details read to determine key ideas;

C899A6B1168A4FD8955649909A62D622.description: make inferences and use evidence to support understanding;Â

10074DCC7CE847ACBE5061B207F1B865.description: make connections to personal experiences, ideas in other texts, and society;

531F921EB4A04268BE855C75971BD0CE.description: create mental images to deepen understanding;

D010C3EDDB8C464799C71BBF158BAB11.description: make and correct or confirm predictions using text features, characteristics of genre, and structures;

5CB35CB8EA3A4B0BAEA37A6E5F991CA1.description: generate questions about text before, during, and after reading to deepen understanding and gain information;

3D8FA6E0864740469FB6A43D06A07D5F.description: establish purpose for reading assigned and self-selected texts;

D51156B8942942C5B8A4F174685DB431.description: Comprehension skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student uses metacognitive skills to both develop and deepen comprehension of increasingly complex texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

033B49E2C6EA43D49163083196E5AF44.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--self-sustained reading. The student reads grade-appropriate texts independently. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to self-select text and read independently for a sustained period of time.

11D8D998194D402598548C44A77D77D3.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--fluency. The student reads grade-level text with fluency and comprehension. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to use appropriate fluency (rate, accuracy, and prosody) and adjust fluency when reading grade-level text based on the reading purpose.

E8AE0B6F938D4C118E43381460AE01AE.description: investigate expressions such as idioms and word relationships such as antonyms, synonyms, and analogies.

1D58C82D9CB442FEB23102E4A95DE760.description: use multiple-meaning words, homographs, homophones, and commonly confused terms correctly; and

F563CB6865F3434E8E9C38971CAA7453.description: identify and use words that name actions, directions, positions, sequences, and locations;

D0743224A3E64DE89C2A7F9E4BEF4A9D.description: determine the meaning and usage of grade-level academic English words derived from Greek, Latin, and other languages, including omni, log/logue, gen, vid/vis, phil, luc, and sens/sent; un-, re-, -ly, and -er/or; and -ion/tion/sion, im- (into), non-, dis-, in- (not, non), pre-, -ness, -y, -er (comparative), -est, and -ful;

87D71448C4EC45CD8DA59360DC7AEDD7.description: use context such as contrast or cause and effect to clarify the meaning of words;

B4A3D275E5C342CA959C761813D4FEDA.description: use print or digital resources to determine the meaning, syllabication, pronunciation, word origin, and part of speech;

6DFE69C40D7446ABA7699698EEE9D0C2.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--vocabulary. The student uses newly acquired vocabulary expressively. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

4169277AD4E043A7A3A1152C20E7A518.description: write complete words, thoughts, and answers legibly.

C28E03BA6F9C4A1EB98BC427B547025B.description: demonstrate and apply phonetic knowledge; and

6A0BFA554C734627BDB61B956A8CB5D5.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--beginning reading and writing. The student develops word structure knowledge through phonological awareness, print concepts, phonics, and morphology to communicate, decode, and spell. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

8CFC1C159C444B2CB1E015CB448A157E.description: develop social communication and produce oral language in contextualized and purposeful ways.

9CBCEDCA85F54A8CBB0B111A3624020D.description: engage in meaningful discourse and provide and accept constructive feedback from others; and

F9F0773A0F8F4891BBBDE8E8C91A7F14.description: present a critique of a literary work, film, or dramatic production, employing eye contact, speaking rate, volume, enunciation, a variety of natural gestures, and conventions of language to communicate ideas effectively;

28948E06D25B41A6B07AC78D6DFF2EB4.description: follow, restate, and give increasingly complex oral instructions to perform specific tasks, answer questions, or solve problems;

4ED76F52271648E98193C111A554DB0F.description: listen actively to interpret a message and ask clarifying questions that build on others' ideas;

FDF93CF544DD454881BD56A2D011DB86.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, discussion, and thinking--oral language. The student develops oral language through listening, speaking, and discussion. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:
